captions.text:
Okay Food Tubers, a zero fat gorgeous,
amazing salad dressing. And if it sounds too
good to be true

then let me show you how to do it. But before
we do this let's just have a comparison

French dressing if I have a pint of
French dressing okay we're talking

well i about 3000 calories. This dressing
 we're gonna do

300 calories and everything's going into
it is really super healthy and gorgeous/
so we're going to put 500 grams of organic
fat-free yogurt in there.
We go in with a good pinch of salt, some pepper.
2 teaspoons of English mustard

I'm gonna go in with some nice herbs
pull the stalks off

that's green and purple basil but you could
go cilantro or coriander

I'm going to go in with a little garlic
now this dressing will last as lonf
as the day on the packet of your yoghurt, okay? So it normally has a week or a bit more

on it and the minute you put garlic
with it just kinda goes off

quite quickly. So I'd only have it for a
couple days if you wanna have it for longer
just don't put the garlic in and

you could have some cayenne pepper or
a little chilli

And then i've got some nice vinegar
here. Some cider vinegar some white
wine vinegar
or even some lemon juice. So I'm going in with about a tablespoon, two tablespoons

of vinegar or the equivalent and lemon
juice

if you are going to use lemon juice then
remember you've also got
zest I'm on your side as well.

So you can choose either vinegar or lemon
juice

or have a little bit of both so I'm
simply
gonna whizz this up
Ohh that's good, oh that is good

that my friends can go in the fridge
let's just dress a little of salad
The lovely color
of the basil.
I love dressings, I love French dressings, I love olvie oil. God you know I love olive oil.

but you know it's nice to have a trick
up your sleeve, zero fat

the happens to be healthy and gorgeous.
Share this on your social media and like it

or comment below in the comments and I
will be reading it. So thank you very
much
God bless you.

title: How to make Zero Fat Salad Dressing | Jamie Oliver

comments.author: Louge Louge

comments.text:
500 grams organic fat free yogurt (17.5 ounces) (or coconut milk yogurt, 
recipe below), salt, pinch of pepper, 2 tsp yellow mustard, basil (or 
cilantro, coriander), 1 clove garlic (or 1/2 - 1 tsp powdered garlic), 
cayenne pepper or a little chilly, 2 T cider vinegar, or lemon juice (zest 
as well), blend and enjoy﻿
comments.author: Pat Beard

comments.text:
For those of us dairy intolerant you can make coconut milk yogurt.  1 can 
full fat coconut milk, 1 capsule probiotic, glass jar with lid.  Mix 2 
ingredients in glass jar, close jar with lid.  Put in oven with "only" oven 
light on, close door, leave for 24 hrs and you have the most delicate, 
delicious yogurt.  Refrigerate﻿

Would love to make a Whole30 approved version.  Allergies to both dairy and

comments.author: Ami Dassow-Oldenburg

comments.text: +Pat Beard Oh, that sounds so good! Gotta give this a try! :)
comments.author: Jan Kolbe

comments.text:
Re: sub for dairy yogurt. You can make coconut milk yogurt in 24 hrs. 1 can 
(or make your own) organic coconut milk, 1 capsule probiotic, opened and 
mixed into coconut milk, mix both ingredients in glass jar, close lid, turn 
on oven light only and put closed jar in oven w/light on only and leave 
closed for 24 hrs. Makes delicious yogurt.
comments.author: Pat Beard

comments.text:
I'd go for some kind of cashew or almond based yogurt. If the fat content 
is not a concern for you and you have a powerful blender, you could soak 
some cashews or almonds over night and puree them with fresh water until 
your desired consistency is achieved and start from there :-)

500g: organic fat free Yogurt
A pinch of Salt
A pinch of black pepper
2 Teaspoons of English Mustard
Green/Purple Basil
Very small amount of Garlic
Half Chilli
2 Tablespoon of Vinegar
A bit of lemon juice or crushed skin of lemon

Hi Jamie. I am a great lover of cheeses and I was thinking of ways to add 
them to your fabulous and inspirational salad dressing. Obviously, I will 
have to use fat free cheese. This is because I don't like salad greens and 
most salad veggies but the dressing could make me swallow, or even, love 
them. Do you think if I add cheese to this wonderful dressing that it would 
affect its taste? Or do you advise me to use cheese separately, such as 
grating it for example on top of the salad? Many thanks in advance. God 
bless.﻿

You just saved my sanity!  I am having a lifestyle change surgically and

comments.author: Teri McHugh

comments.text:
WOW! Really just wow....i really needed to comment after i tried this 
dressing recipe! This is a true master creation Jamie!! Very very brilliant 
dressing omg..a MUST TRY!!! I am forever using this recipe and not buying 
those toxin filled Kraft salad dressings. Extremely easy and valuable to 
make. I am going to eat salad all the time now to cure candida, eczema, and 
any body gut, skin issues i have.

I used almost all same ingredients, organic vanilla yogurt, real dijon 
mustard, a little bit of apple cider vinegar, balsamic vinegar, honey, 
parsley, coriander powder, no hot pepper but instead used sriracha hot 
sauce, and some dill herbs, salt and pepper..and OMG! also just be advised 
to always spin your salad to remove excess water or the sauce gets very 
watery, but still and very tangy pungent, and flavorful dressing!! very 
yummy!!﻿
